summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Fraud Detection Web App including backend APIs, frontend UI, authentication, dataset upload, model training, and all major features. Most functionality working correctly with minor issues identified.

flaky_endpoints.issue: Model training fails with small datasets due to insufficient fraud samples for stratified split
flaky_endpoints.impact: Blocks model training with datasets having <2 samples per class
flaky_endpoints.workaround: Use larger, more balanced datasets for training

access_control_working.behavior: Correctly restricts access to admin users only

design_issues.issue: Missing aria-describedby attributes in dialog components

minor_issues.issue: Training may fail with small datasets but UI doesn't show clear error message

passed_tests: User registration with analyst and admin roles
JWT token validation and auth/me endpoint
Dashboard metrics display (Total Transactions, Fraudulent Count, Active Alerts, Blocked Entities, Fraud Detection Rate)
Transactions page with filters (all, fraudulent, suspicious, safe)
Analytics page with charts and model metrics
Audit logs API (admin access restriction working)
Frontend responsive design and UI components
action_item_for_main_agent: 1. Improve dataset validation to show clear error messages when dataset is too small for training (minimum 2 samples per class required). 2. Add aria-describedby attributes to dialog components for better accessibility. 3. Consider adding better error handling and user feedback for model training failures.

success_percentage.backend: 76.5% (13/17 tests passed - 3 failures due to small dataset, 1 expected admin restriction)
success_percentage.frontend: 100% (All UI components, navigation, forms, and integrations working)
